t: For the choir director: “Do Not Destroy.” A psalm of Asaph. A song.
We*pn give thanks to you, God; we*ln give thanks to you, for your name is near. People*ln tell about your wondrous works.
“When*pn I choose a time, I*ln will judge fairly.
When*ln the earth and all its inhabitants shake, I*ln am the one who steadies its pillars. Selah*ig
I*ln say to the boastful, ‘Do not boast,’ and*ln to the wicked, ‘Do not lift up your horn.
Do*ln not lift up your horn against heaven or*ln speak arrogantly.’”
Exaltation*pn does not come from*ln the east, the west, or the desert,
for*ln God is the Judge: He*ln brings down one and exalts another.
For*ln there is a cup in the Lord’s*s hand, full*ln of wine blended with spices, and he pours from it. All*ln the wicked of the earth will drink, draining*ln it to the dregs.
As*pn for me, I will tell about him forever; I*ln will sing praise to the God of Jacob.
“I*pn will cut off all the horns of the wicked, but*ln the horns of the righteous will be lifted up.”
